content.question: Researchers examined infants’ depth perception in what is known as the visual cliff experiment. Which of the following statements might be an ethical concern related to using a visual cliff with infants?

choices.label: Infants could have experienced distress when they looked at the visual drop or were encouraged by their mothers to cross it.
The researchers did not obtain informed consent from the infants participating in the study.
Infants’ depth perception could have been fundamentally altered by the study, putting the children at risk.
It is always unethical to study how children develop fears, such as a fear of heights.

content.answer: Infants could have experienced distress when they looked at the visual drop or were encouraged by their mothers to cross it.

skill.text: 2.D: Evaluate whether a psychological research scenario followed appropriate ethical procedures.
